qas.question: Which NBA team temporarily relocated to Oklahoma?
Where did the temporary NBA team play in Oklahoma?
What caused the temporary NBA team to relocate to Oklahoma?
What was the Thunder's previous name?

context: The NBA's <a0_0>New Orleans Hornets<a0_0/> became the first major league sports franchise based in Oklahoma when the team was forced to relocate to <a1_0>Oklahoma City's Ford Center<a1_0/>, now known as Chesapeake Energy Arena, for two seasons following <a2_0>Hurricane Katrina<a2_0/> in 2005. In July 2008, the <a3_0>Seattle SuperSonics<a3_0/>, a franchise owned by the <a4_0>Professional Basketball Club LLC<a4_0/>, a group of Oklahoma City businessmen led by Clayton Bennett, relocated to Oklahoma City and announced that play would begin at the Ford Center as the Oklahoma City Thunder for the 2008–09 season, becoming the state's first permanent major league franchise.
